Jesus, in taking charge of the temple court, had wrought there a wonderful change. He had banished the buyers and sellers, the 
                                                                           28
money-changers and the cattle; "and would not suffer that any man should carry any vessel through the temple." So sacred did the world's Redeemer regard the building dedicated to the worship of God. The priests and rulers dared not show open hostility to Jesus in presence of the people who had witnessed his wonderful works. Though enraged and confounded by his answer they were unable to accomplish anything farther that day.
